intro: Retinispora devriesiana, commonly known as the Devries's retinispora, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae, which includes nutmeg and other aromatic evergreen trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
